boardgame.name: Battle Cry
Battlecry
boardgame.description: A low complexity game of a variety of civil war battles. Modular terrain through the use of hexagonal tiles allows for the setup of several famous civil war battle fields and a plethora of plastic civil war miniatures are used to represent the various forces during the conflict (infantry, cavalry, artillery and leaders). Players manage a hand of cards that provide different orders to your troops in the right flank, left flank and center position of the battlefield._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This game is the first to use what would evolve into Richard Borg's Command and Colors system._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game rules include the following scenarios:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;First Bull Run--21st July, 1861_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Pea Ridge--7th March, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Kernstown--23rd March, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Shiloh--6th April, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Gaines Mill--27th June, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Brawner's Farm--28th August, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Antietam--17th September, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Fredericksburg--13th December, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Murfreesboro--31st December, 1862_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Chancellorsville--3rd May, 1863_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Gettysburg--2nd July, 1863_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Gettysburg--3rd July, 1863_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Chickamauga--20th September, 1863_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;New Market--15th May, 1864_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;New Hope Church--25th May, 1864_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Wizards of the Coast - Battle Cry Language: English Players: 2 Age: 10+ Duration: about 45 min Weight: 1.980 kg New - mint condition - unopened - still in shrink wrap. Theme: New 150 years ago celebration edition. Civil War is now upon us, and you must take the field as the leader of the Union or the Confederate forces. Command your generals and direct your infantry, cavalry, and artillery in 30 different scenarios that feature the terrain and troop deployment of each historical battle - from the First Bull Run and Wilson_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Creek to Prairie Grove and Gettysburg. History may have been written, but in Battle Cry, the outcome of each battle is up to you. With your strategy and tactics, you can turn the tide to carry Old Glory or Dixie to victory. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.

NOTE: This is the Hasbro/Avalon Hill 1999/2000 edition of Battle Cry. This is NOT the 2010 reprint. The game is unpunched and unplayed. The game is no longer in shrinkwrap, but it has never been played or setup. The plastic pieces are still on the 4 sprues. The card deck is unopened. The terrain tiles/field works/campaign markers are unpunched. The labels are still on the label sheet. The game box is in incredibly great shape after 10+ years. On the box top, you can see indentations where other boxes have sit on top. These indentations are small and you have to really look for them. It appears that the printing on the box covers (both top and bottom) are still intact. Game comes from non-smoking house.

Wizards of the Coast (WOC 282950000) Ready the Cannon! Fix Bayonets! Prepare to Charge! Civil War is now upon us, and you must take the field as the leader of the Union or the Confederate forces. Command your generals and direct your infantry, cavalry, and artillery in 30 different scenarios that feature the terrain and troop deployment of each historical battle - from the First Bull Run and Wilson’s Creek to Prairie Grove and Gettysburg. History may have been written, but in Battle Cry, the outcome of each battle is up to you. With your strategy and tactics, you can turn the tide to carry Old Glory or Dixie to victory.

(shipping to US only... $16.00) light shelf wear to the box _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;see pics_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;.. components are in great shape. A low complexity game of a variety of civil war battles. Modular terrain through the use of hexagonal tiles allows for the setup of several famous civil war battle fields and a plethora of plastic civil war miniatures are used to represent the various forces during the conflict (infantry, cavalry, artillery and leaders). Players manage a hand of cards that provide different orders to your troops in the right flank, left flank and center position of the battlefield. This game is the first to use what would evolve into Richard Borg_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Command and Colors system. The game rules include the following scenarios: First Bull Run--21st July, 1861 Pea Ridge--7th March, 1862 Kernstown--23rd March, 1862 Shiloh--6th April, 1862 Gaines Mill--27th June, 1862 Brawner_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Farm--28th August, 1862 Antietam--17th September, 1862 Fredericksburg--13th December, 1862 Murfreesboro--31st December, 1862 Chancellorsville--3rd May, 1863 Gettysburg--2nd July, 1863 Gettysburg--3rd July, 1863 Chickamauga--20th September, 1863 New Market--15th May, 1864 New Hope Church--25th May, 1864

This item is posted as a part of the WargameHQ Shelf Clearing Auction. The item listed is only for purchase by: heirloom The price has been set at the winning bid, or Buy It Now, price posted to the auction item comment page. If you won multiple items, please be sure to add them all to your cart at once and then check out so I can include them in your shipping estimate. As a reminder: I will only ship to the addresses within the United States. I only accept PayPal and payment details will be sent alongside your final invoice. Your item(s) will ship on the Saturday FOLLOWING verified payment. I will provide tracking information for your item and insurance sufficient to cover the final price of the auction on shipped items. Please inspect your items within the first 5 business days of receipt, beyond that I cannot assist with disputes. I also make no guarantees implied or otherwise as to the condition of games if the carrier has been rough with shipping. I pack games in peanuts and try to ensure both the games and their contents are secured inside the boxes to minimize issues. If you fail to pay for your item within 5 business days, I will cancel the sale and list the item on eBay and you can re-bid on it there at that time. If you have any special requests, please Geekmail me so we can discuss prior to payment finalization. Thank you for your purchase and I hope you enjoy your new game(s)!
